input.title: Azure Key Vault Open Network Access - ai-empire-vault-01
input.body:
## Issue Description

High severity issue: Key Vault 'ai-empire-vault-01' has open network access.

### Details
- ID: AZ-003
- Module: Azure
- Level: High

### Recommended Fix
Restrict network access to the Key Vault by configuring firewall rules or private endpoints. This requires manual intervention as automated tools are read-only for Azure.

### Priority
Immediate action required to prevent unauthorized access.

result.error: {"message":"Resource not accessible by integration","documentation_url":"https://docs.github.com/rest/issues/issues#create-an-issue","status":"403"}

input.title: GitHub Repository is Public
input.body:
## Issue Description

High severity issue: Repository is set to Public, exposing source code.

### Details
- ID: GH-001
- Module: GitHub
- Level: High

### Recommended Fix
Change repository visibility to Private. Review and remove any sensitive information if already exposed. This requires manual intervention.

### Priority
Immediate action required to secure source code.

input.content:
## Azure Security Issues (Added 2026)

### Problem: Tool Limitations for Azure Repairs
- **Root Cause**: The `azure_run_cli` tool is restricted to specific read-only verbs (describe, show, list, account, get), but subcommands like 'keyvault' or 'cognitiveservices' are not allowed, causing all queries to fail.
- **Affected Issues**: AZ-003 (Key Vault open access), AZ-004 (AI services public access).
- **Repair Strategy**: Due to read-only restrictions and no update capabilities, all Azure issues must be handled manually. Attempt to query status first, but if failed, mark as skipped and recommend manual fix.
- **Lessons Learned**: Expand tool permissions for broader read-only access or add dedicated tools for Azure resource management. For high/medium difficulty, fallback to manual processes.

### Example Failed Commands
- az keyvault show --name <name> --query "properties.networkAcls" (fails on 'keyvault' verb)
- az cognitiveservices account show --name <name> --query "properties.publicNetworkAccess" (fails on 'cognitiveservices' verb)

### Validation
Re-run security scans after manual fixes to confirm resolution.

## GitHub Security Issues (Added 2026)

### Problem: Public Repository Exposure
- **Root Cause**: Repository visibility set to public, risking source code exposure.
- **Affected Issues**: GH-001.
- **Repair Strategy**: Change visibility to private manually, as no automated tool is available for this action. Attempted to create tracking issue failed due to 403 permission error (resource not accessible by integration).
- **Lessons Learned**: Ensure AI integration has sufficient GitHub permissions for issue creation and potentially repo management. For high difficulty issues, escalate to human review.

### Validation
Check repository settings post-fix to ensure it's private.
